trans-unit.source: Represents a panel that dynamically lays out its contents horizontally or vertically.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutPanel> control arranges its contents in a horizontal or vertical flow direction.
Its contents can be wrapped from one row to the next, or from one column to the next.
Alternatively, its contents can be clipped instead of wrapped.
You can specify the flow direction by setting the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutPanel.FlowDirection%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutPanel> control correctly reverses its flow direction in right-to-left (RTL) layouts.

You can also specify whether the contents of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutPanel> control are wrapped or clipped by setting the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutPanel.WrapContents%2A> property.
Any Windows Forms control, including other instances of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutPanel>, can be a child of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutPanel> control.
With this capability, you can construct sophisticated layouts that adapt to your form's dimensions at run time.
Docking and anchoring behaviors of child controls differ from the behaviors in other container controls.
Both docking and anchoring are relative to the largest control in the flow direction.

For more information, see [How to: Anchor and Dock Child Controls in a FlowLayoutPanel Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/how-to-anchor-and-dock-child-controls-in-a-flowlayoutpanel-control.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutPanel"></xref> class.

This constructor sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutPanel.FlowDirection%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutPanel.WrapContents%2A> properties to their default values: <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowDirection.LeftToRight> and `true`, respectively.
Gets or sets a value indicating the flow direction of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutPanel"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutPanel.FlowDirection%2A> property is the default property for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutPanel> class.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FlowDirection"></xref> values indicating the direction of consecutive placement of controls in the panel.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FlowDirection.LeftToRight"></xref>.
Returns a value that represents the flow-break setting of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutPanel"></xref> control.
The child control.
`true` if the flow break is set; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a cached instance of the panel's layout engine.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.LayoutEngine"></xref> for the panel's contents.
Sets the value that represents the flow-break setting of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutPanel"></xref> control.
The child control.
The flow-break value to set.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutPanel"></xref> control should wrap its contents or let the contents be clipped.
If the area of the panel is too small to contain all its child controls, at least one child control will be clipped regardless of the wrapping mode.
Subsequent resizing of the panel will reapply the layout to the contained controls.
`true` if the contents should be wrapped; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IExtenderProvider.CanExtend(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutPanel> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IExtenderProvider> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to receive the extender properties.
`true` if this object can provide extender properties to the specified object; otherwise, `false`.
